meanings.definition: A stream of air or water driven back by a revolving propeller or jet engine.
meanings.sent1: The airplane's slipstreams helped it fly faster.
meanings.sent2: I felt the slipstreams as the plane took off.
meanings.sent3: The slipstreams from the boat made the seagulls fly in circles.
meanings.sent4: The slipstreams of thoughts in his mind were hard to control.
meanings.sent5: The slipstreams of wind carried the scent of flowers to my nose.

meanings.definition: A stream of air or water driven back by a moving object.
meanings.sent1: The car's slipstreams caused leaves to swirl behind it.
meanings.sent2: I could see the slipstreams in the water as the boat sped by.
meanings.sent3: The slipstreams from the fan made the papers on the desk dance.
meanings.sent4: Her words created slipstreams of excitement in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The slipstreams of raindrops on the window blurred the view outside.
